Posts.Content: Sep 9, 2011 12:00PM cindyp15 wrote: This is year 10 for me as stage IV.  I was originally diagnosed in 1995 as stage II. In 2001, liver mets and sternum mets were found. I've been off/on chemo and hormonals since then. My liver mets were completely wiped away from Taxol back in 2001, but keep coming back now.  I'm currently doing Abraxane and Herceptin and Zometa. I'm somewhat stable and still hoping to knock it back out again!

Posts.Content: cindyp15 wrote: I just completed my first round of taxotere/carbo/heceptin given once every 3 wks. I was hospitalized for colitis from the chemo. My next treatment is scheduled next week. My dr is stopping the carbo & changing me to weekly taxotere/herceptin at a lower dose. I'm scared to death of doing round 2 due to my severe reaction. Has anyone else had this happen before, the colitis?  If so, do you think the smaller weekly dose will be more tolerable? I gained 10 lbs of fluid while in the hospital and am just now losing that. I don't know if I should try doing round 2 or ask for a new chemo? Dx 6/20/1995, DCIS, 2cm, Stage IV, 1/11 nodes, mets, ER+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
